eprllib.Env.MultiAgent package¶

Submodules¶

eprllib.Env.MultiAgent.EnergyPlusEnvironment module¶

# ENERGYPLUS RLLIB ENVIRONMENT

This script define the environment of EnergyPlus implemented in RLlib. To works need to define the EnergyPlus Runner.

class eprllib.Env.MultiAgent.EnergyPlusEnvironment.EnergyPlusEnv_v0(env_config: Dict[str, Any])[source]¶

Bases: MultiAgentEnv

The EnergyPlusEnv_v0 class represents a multi-agent environment for reinforcement learning tasks related to building energy simulation using EnergyPlus software. It inherits from the MultiAgentEnv class, which suggests that it supports multiple agents interacting with the environment.

The class initializes with an env_config dictionary that contains various configuration settings for the environment, such as the list of agent IDs, action spaces, observable variables, actuators, meters, and other EnergyPlus-related settings.

The reset method is responsible for setting up a new episode of the environment. It increments the episode counter, initializes queues for communication between the environment and EnergyPlus, and starts an instance of the EnergyPlusRunner class, which likely handles the EnergyPlus simulation.

The step method is the core of the environment, where agents take actions, and the environment updates its state accordingly. It processes the provided actions, communicates with the EnergyPlus simulation through queues, retrieves observations and information from the simulation, calculates rewards based on a specified reward function, and determines if the episode should terminate or truncate.

The close method is used to stop the EnergyPlus simulation when the environment is no longer needed.

The render method is currently a placeholder and does not perform any rendering functionality.

Overall, this class encapsulates the logic for running EnergyPlus simulations as part of a multi-agent reinforcement learning environment, allowing agents to interact with the building energy simulation and receive observations, rewards, and termination signals based on their actions.

close()[source]¶

After the user has finished using the environment, close contains the code necessary to “clean up” the environment.

This is critical for closing rendering windows, database or HTTP connections.

render(mode='human')[source]¶

Tries to render the environment.

reset(*, seed: int | None = None, options: Dict[str, Any] | None = None)[source]¶

Resets the env and returns observations from ready agents.

Parameters:

seed – An optional seed to use for the new episode.

Returns:

New observations for each ready agent.

step(action)[source]¶

Returns observations from ready agents.

The returns are dicts mapping from agent_id strings to values. The number of agents in the env can vary over time.

Returns:

Tuple containing 1) new observations for each ready agent, 2) reward values for each ready agent. If the episode is just started, the value will be None. 3) Terminated values for each ready agent. The special key “__all__” (required) is used to indicate env termination. 4) Truncated values for each ready agent. 5) Info values for each agent id (may be empty dicts).

eprllib.Env.MultiAgent.EnergyPlusRunner module¶

# ENERGYPLUS RUNNER

This script contain the EnergyPlus Runner that execute EnergyPlus from its Python API in the version 23.2.0.

class eprllib.Env.MultiAgent.EnergyPlusRunner.EnergyPlusRunner(episode: int, env_config: Dict[str, Any], obs_queue: Queue, act_queue: Queue, infos_queue: Queue, _agent_ids: Set, _thermal_zone_ids: Set)[source]¶

Bases: object

This object have the particularity of start EnergyPlus, _collect_obs and _send_actions to send it trhougt queue to the EnergyPlus Environment thread.

make_eplus_args() → List[str][source]¶

Make command line arguments to pass to EnergyPlus

start() → None[source]¶

This method inicialize EnergyPlus. First the episode is configurate, the calling functions established and the thread is generated here.

stop() → None[source]¶

Method to stop EnergyPlus simulation and joint the threads.

eprllib.Env.MultiAgent.EnvUtils module¶

This module contain the utils used in the Multi-agent definition files.

eprllib.Env.MultiAgent.EnvUtils.EP_API_add_path(version: str | None = '23-2-0', path: str | None = None)[source]¶

This method add the EnergyPlus Python API to the system path. This allow to use the EnergyPlus program in Python. The minimal version of EnergyPlus is 9.3.0 and the default version (and the stable one) for eprllib is 23-2-0.

Parameters:

  • version (str, optional) – Numeric version of EnergyPlus. Defaults to “23-2-0”.

  • path (Optional[str], optional) – Complete path to the EnergyPlus installation directory

  • None. (if this is different that the default installation. Defaults to)

Returns:

Print the EnergyPlus API path added to the system path.

Return type:

None

eprllib.Env.MultiAgent.EnvUtils.runner_value_inspection(env_config: Dict)[source]¶

Module contents¶

The multi-agent aproach allow to run multiples agents in the environment, but also a single agent. The standard configuration use a policy with fully shared parameters.

You can check the entire configuration of the multi-agent approach in the multiagent_config.py file on ExampleFiles folder.

eprllib
